intro: Psychotria paniculata, commonly known as the red panicled psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Psychotria paniculata is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
